title: North America to expect a fall in market share for Enterprise Mobile Security (EMS) in 2015 inspite of a healthy double digit growth rate
text:
The report titled Enterprise Mobile Security Market - North America Outlook (2015-19) showcases an in-depth analysis of the Enterprise Mobile Security market in terms of market size and the respective market forces (drivers, constraints, opportunities and challenges). This report also forecasts the growth numbers till 2019 (on a YoY basis) and hence suggests the Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) for the estimated period.
BYOD and COPE to foster growth in USA
With the high use of employee mobility and thereby increased use of BYOD, cyber misconducts have increased in the recent past. The trend looks sharping making it difficult for companies to manage cyber issues. This becomes a ground for companies to sell their security products and services.
The reasons for growth of Enterprise Mobile Security (EMS) in North America include:
1. Higher rate of cyber-crimes on USA which includes mobile devices
2. Increased need for employee mobility and telecommuting
3. Higher use of BYOD and COPE
Market Segments and Forecasts Covered in the Report
The North America Enterprise Mobile Security market is segmented by:
· Deployment (On-Premise, Cloud)
· End users (Enterprise, Mid-size, Small Business)
· Industry (Financial Services, E-commerce, IT and Telecommunication, Healthcare, Retail, Others)
Companies discussed in the Global Enterprise Mobile Security market research report are Kaspersky, McAfee, Symantec, AVG, Sourcefire, IBM, Palo Alto Networks, Check Point Software Technologies, NQ mobile, Viasat, Safenet, AT&T, Inside Secure, Dell, HP, Blue Coat Systems, F-Secure, TrendMicro, CA Technologies and Oracle.
